intro: Chiritopsis jingxiensis, commonly known as the Jingxiensis chiritopsis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in a head, and the leaves are usually narrow and hairy. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
